greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Let k = n-th nonsquare = A000037(n); then a(n) = smallest prime p such that the Kronecker-Jacobi symbol K(k,p) = -1.
comment: Maple calls K(k,p) the Legendre symbol.
The old entry with this sequence number was a duplicate of A024356.
reference: H. Cohen, A Course in Computational Number Theory, Springer, 1996 (p. 28 defines the Kronecker-Jacobi symbol).
link: Charles R Greathouse IV, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
maple: with(numtheory); f:=proc(n) local M,i,j,k; M:=100000; for i from 1 to M do if legendre(n,ithprime(i)) = -1 then RETURN(ithprime(i)); fi; od; -1; end;
program: (PARI) a(n)=my(k=n+(sqrtint(4*n)+1)\2); forprime(p=2,, if(kronecker(k,p)<0, return(p))) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Aug 28 2016
xref: Cf. A000037. Records: A067073, A070040. See A144294 for another version.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Oct 16 2008, Oct 17 2008. Definition corrected Dec 03 2008.
